title: Princess Eugenie gushes about 'greatest day' on first wedding anniversary

Princess Eugenie has gushed about "the greatest day of my life" while celebrating her first wedding anniversary with husband Jack Brooksbank.

Eugenie posted a video highlight reel on Instagram showing intimate and behind-the-scenes moments from the ceremony and the couple's preparations for their big day.

She wrote to her one million followers: "This was the greatest day of my life...forever and always! Happy one year anniversary, my Jack!!"

Eugenie, 29, and Mr Brooksbank, a 33-year-old wine merchant from London, tied the knot at St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle on October 12, 2018 - the same place where Prince Harry and Meghan Markle wed just five months earlier.

(Image: Getty Images)

Another royal wedding is on the cards, with Eugenie's older sister, Princess Beatrice, 31, due to marry Italian property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, 34, next year.

To celebrate the anniversary, the Royal Family's Twitter account posted a snap of Eugenie and Mr Brooksbank kissing outside the chapel after becoming husband and wife.

It wrote: "Congratulations to Her Royal Highness Princess Eugenie and Mr Jack Brooksbank on their 1st Wedding Anniversary!

(Image: Twitter)

"Today marks one year since Her Royal Highness and Mr Brooksbank exchanged vows as St George’s Chapel within the grounds of Windsor Castle on October 12th, 2018."

Eugenie was walked down the aisle by her dad, Prince Andrew, before she and Mr Brooksbank said their I dos in front of family, including her mum Sarah Ferguson, her grandmother the Queen, Harry and Meghan and Prince William and Kate Middleton.

Foreign royalty and friends including Cara Delevingne, Robbie Williams, Ellie Goulding, Naomi Campbell, Kate Moss and Pippa Middleton were among the 850 guests.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

About 1,200 members of the public, selected by ballot, were gathered in the castle grounds.

Eugenie wore an ivory open-back dress with a flowing full length train designed by Peter Pilotto and Christopher de Vos.

She borrowed the Greville Emerald Kokoshnik Tiara from the Queen.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Eugenie picked her sister Beatrice to be her maid of honour, while the groom's brother, Thomas Brooksbank, was his best man.

The bridesmaids included Princess Charlotte, Zara Tindall's elder daughter Mia and singer Mr Williams' daughter Ayda Field.

Future king Prince George served as one of the two page boys.

The Dean of Windsor, David Conner, officiated as the nuptials were shown live on ITV.

Earlier this week, Harry and singer Ed Sheeran posted a World Mental Health Day spoof video that appeared to be filmed at Eugenie's Kensington Palace home in west London.

Looking ahead to Beatrice's wedding, mum Fergie quashed speculation that it could be held in Italy, saying it "can only be Britain".
description: Princess Eugenie posted a video highlight reel on Instagram as she and husband Jack Brooksbank celebrated their first wedding anniversary
